case_title: M/S Habib Modaraba Management (Pvt.) Limited vs Commissioner (Appeals), SRB, Karachi and Assistant Commissioner (Unit-), SRB, Karachi

facts.service_provided: Management services including fund and assets management services
facts.financial_statement: M/S First Habib Modaraba for the year 2011-12 revealed Rs.95,408,940 paid as management fees
facts.failure: Non-filing of sales tax returns and non-payment of sales tax

legal_issues: Whether Modaraba and Modaraba Management Companies are one and the same entity?
Whether the transaction constitutes a service?
Whether the services fall under taxable tariff heading 9824.0000?
Whether tax liability arises from remuneration received from profit earned?

key_findings.modaraba_and_management_company: Separate legal entities with distinct rights and liabilities
key_findings.nature_of_service: Management services including fund and asset management
key_findings.taxability: Remuneration received is taxable under tariff heading 9824.0000

penalties.default_surcharge: Under section 44 of the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011

arguments_by_appellant: Remuneration is a share of profit, not service charges
No service is provided; Modaraba and Management Company are partners
Remuneration depends on profit earned by Modaraba
Sales tax contradicts the legal principle of 'quid pro quo'
Remuneration is fixed by law under Section 18 of the Modaraba Ordinance
arguments_by_respondent: Modaraba and Management Company are not partners
Management services are taxable under tariff heading 9824.0000
Both entities are separate legal persons under the Modaraba Ordinance
precedents_cited: M/S UDL Modaraba Management Company vs Commissioner Appeals, SRB
M/S Habib Safe Deposit Vault (Pvt.) Limited vs SRB
final_decision: The appeal was dismissed, confirming the taxability of management services provided by the appellant under tariff heading 9824.0000.
